messages.content:
You are a world state generator for a workplace benchmark. Your job is to transform an abstract scenario into a concrete, detailed world_state JSON.

The world_state should include:
1. All metadata from the scenario (scenario_id, description, noise_level, depth, global_settings, people, projects)
2. sub_scenarios_expanded: For each abstract sub_scenario from the input scenario, create a concrete expanded version with:
   - Concrete ISO datetime timestamps
   - Specific participant IDs/emails
   - Detailed event descriptions
   - Any seeds needed for data generation
   - This array should contain ONLY the expanded versions of the sub_scenarios listed in the input scenario
3. noise_scenarios: An array of noise-only scenario objects that are NOT part of the core sub_scenarios:
   - These should be realistic but unrelated workplace events/messages/activities
   - Each noise scenario should have similar structure to sub_scenarios_expanded (id, type, timestamps, participants, etc.)
   - The number of noise scenarios should scale with the noise_level parameter

IMPORTANT: Do NOT include per_source_plans in the world_state. The world_state is scenario-centric only.

IMPORTANT PARAMETERS:
- noise_level (0-1): Controls amount of unrelated/off-task data
  * 0 = almost no noise, only data directly relevant to sub_scenarios (noise_scenarios should be empty or minimal)
  * 1 = lots of unrelated messages/events/files (still realistic) (noise_scenarios should contain many entries)
- depth (0-1): Controls how indirect the evidence is
  * 0 = sub_scenario realized directly (e.g., one clear Slack message)
  * 1 = sub_scenario requires multi-step, multi-source chaining to infer
  * Intermediate values interpolate behavior

CRITICAL: sub_scenarios_expanded must correspond exactly to the sub_scenarios in the input scenario. All other unrelated scenarios should go in noise_scenarios.

You must output ONLY valid JSON matching the world_state schema. Do not include markdown code fences.

Generate a world_state JSON from this scenario:

{
  "scenario_id": "scenario_noise0_depth0",
  "description": "Planning meeting scenario with no noise and direct (noise=0.0, depth=0.0)",
  "noise_level": 0.0,
  "depth": 0.0,
  "global_settings": {
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "workday_start": "09:00",
    "workday_end": "18:00"
  },
  "org_units": [
    "Engineering",
    "Product"
  ],
  "people": [
    {
      "id": "person_alex_smith",
      "name": "Alex Smith",
      "email": "alex.smith@company.com",
      "team": "Engineering",
      "role": "PM"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_jordan_johnson",
      "name": "Jordan Johnson",
      "email": "jordan.johnson@company.com",
      "team": "Product",
      "role": "Engineer"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_sam_williams",
      "name": "Sam Williams",
      "email": "sam.williams@company.com",
      "team": "Engineering",
      "role": "Engineer"
    },
    {
      "id": "person_taylor_brown",
      "name": "Taylor Brown",
      "email": "taylor.brown@company.com",
      "team": "Product",
      "role": "Designer"
    }
  ],
  "projects": [
    {
      "id": "project_main",
      "name": "Main Product",
      "type": "software_development",
      "status": "active"
    }
  ],
  "sub_scenarios": [
    {
      "id": "planning_meeting_1",
      "type": "planning_meeting",
      "abstract_description": "Team planning meeting to discuss project progress and next steps",
      "participants_hint": [
        "Alex Smith",
        "Jordan Johnson",
        "Sam Williams"
      ],
      "constraints_hint": "Meeting should be scheduled for next week, during working hours (09:00-18:00), with a duration of 45 minutes. All participants must be available."
    }
  ]
}

Remember:
- noise_level=0.0: Generate minimal noise
- depth=0.0: Make evidence direct

Output the complete world_state JSON now.

raw_message.content:
{
  "scenario_id": "scenario_noise0_depth0",
  "description": "Planning meeting scenario with no noise and direct (noise=0.0, depth=0.0)",
  "noise_level": 0.0,
  "depth": 0.0,
  "global_settings": {
    "timezone": "America/New_York",
    "workday_start": "09:00",
    "workday_end": "18:00"

    }
  ],
  "sub_scenarios_expanded": [
    {
      "id": "planning_meeting_1",
      "type": "planning_meeting",
      "seed": 12345,
      "abstract_description": "Team planning meeting to discuss project progress and next steps",
      "constraints_hint": "Meeting should be scheduled for next week, during working hours (09:00-18:00), with a duration of 45 minutes. All participants must be available.",
      "participants": [
        "person_alex_smith",
        "person_jordan_johnson",
        "person_sam_williams"
      ],
      "events": [
        {
          "id": "planning_meeting_1_event_1",
          "timestamp": "2025-01-06T10:02:00-05:00",
          "channel": "email",
          "from": "person_alex_smith",
          "to": [
            "person_jordan_johnson",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "subject": "Planning Meeting for Main Product - Next Week",
          "body": "Hi Jordan and Sam,\n\nI'd like to schedule a 45-minute planning meeting next week to review Main Product progress and align on next steps.\n\nProposed time: Tuesday, January 7, 2025, from 10:00 AM to 10:45 AM Eastern.\n\nPlease let me know if this works for you. If I don't hear otherwise, I'll send a calendar invite for that slot.\n\nThanks,\nAlex",
          "related_project_id": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "planning_meeting_1_event_2",
          "timestamp": "2025-01-06T10:15:00-05:00",
          "channel": "email",
          "from": "person_jordan_johnson",
          "to": [
            "person_alex_smith",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Planning Meeting for Main Product - Next Week",
          "body": "Hi Alex,\n\nTuesday, January 7 from 10:00â€“10:45 AM ET works for me.\n\nJordan",
          "related_project_id": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "planning_meeting_1_event_3",
          "timestamp": "2025-01-06T10:22:00-05:00",
          "channel": "email",
          "from": "person_sam_williams",
          "to": [
            "person_alex_smith",
            "person_jordan_johnson"
          ],
          "subject": "Re: Planning Meeting for Main Product - Next Week",
          "body": "Hi Alex,\n\nThat time works for me as well. Looking forward to it.\n\nSam",
          "related_project_id": "project_main"
        },
        {
          "id": "planning_meeting_1_event_4",
          "timestamp": "2025-01-06T10:30:00-05:00",
          "channel": "calendar",
          "from": "person_alex_smith",
          "to": [
            "person_jordan_johnson",
            "person_sam_williams"
          ],
          "subject": "Main Product - Planning Meeting",
          "body": "Agenda:\n1. Current progress review\n2. Upcoming sprint scope\n3. Risks and dependencies\n4. Next steps and owners",
          "calendar_event": {
            "id": "cal_planning_meeting_main_product_20250107",
            "title": "Main Product - Planning Meeting",
            "organizer": "person_alex_smith",
            "participants": [
              "person_alex_smith",
              "person_jordan_johnson",
              "person_sam_williams"
            ],
            "start_time": "2025-01-07T10:00:00-05:00",
            "end_time": "2025-01-07T10:45:00-05:00",
            "location": "Zoom",
            "conference_link": "https://zoom.us/j/1234567890",
            "timezone": "America/New_York",
            "related_project_id": "project_main",
            "description": "Planning meeting to discuss Main Product progress and next steps.\n\nAgenda:\n1. Current progress review\n2. Upcoming sprint scope\n3. Risks and dependencies\n4. Next steps and owners"
          },
          "related_project_id": "project_main"
        }
      ]
    }
  ],
  "noise_scenarios": []
}
